job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good Pay for the position.
cons: Patient ratio not so much.

job_title: EVS Housekeeping in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Pay is decent the hospital staff for the most part are great
cons: Some evs supervisors are rude and talk down to you. For discharges they slave drive you and are more concerned over quantity not quality. You must account for every minute you are at work so be prepared to write it down if you need to use the restroom at all during your shift. They will also tell you that they are not required to give u two 10 minute breaks if they are busy you wont get your second one.

job_title: Physical Therapist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Little micro management from upper management Large amount of autonomy for the work day
cons: Management is passive aggressive and no problems get resolved Management does not stick up for their rehab team

job_title: MRI Technologist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good benefits, clean hospital, decent wages for the area
cons: Severe staff shortages throughout HCA. Be prepared to work short or get your hours cut periodically

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: There are no pros for this hospital.
cons: Mountainveiw hospital is a very toxic and hostile working environment. Bullying, intimidation and favoritism is common practice for management. the unfairness is shocking. The policies apply to some and not others. It all depends on who your friends are. Bullying, intimidation and exclusion between staff nurses is tolerated and encouraged by management. Physical and verbal abuse is also tolerated. Experienced nurses are disrespected and dismissed. These problems have been reported to the CNO, ACNO and the HR specialist many times. What's most disturbing is despite all the complaints, these problems are not properly addressed.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Good starting pay for new grads
cons: Short staff like all places atp

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great benefits, very competitive pay. Lots of available hours to work(because they're always short staffed)
cons: Always short staffed. Poor work culture(gossip, negativity, backbiting). The amazing CEO who opened the hospital left.... nothing has been the same since. Morale is at an all time low as of 2021. Sad. Used to be a great hospital. Don't leave your family alone here!!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great place to start as a new grad.
cons: The hospital is big and can easily get lost

job_title: Physical Therapist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Nurses care.. ok healthcare/ benefits..
cons: Poor management that chooses favorites, do not have patient care staff's best interests.. low pay for the expectation.. PPE was reserved for admin not those providing patient care. Admin first, then patients then staff. TOXIC environment.. admin pick and choose their favorites..

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great team of nurses, supper helpful, hard working individuals. The company pay well
cons: Horrible management, nurses are not treated nicely by management. Several times, nurses work extra hours to help with short staffing and their checks are delayed or brake down in 3 payments like happened to me. I had to fight with HR and payroll several times to pay my hours missed in my check. Last time I work extra, I sign up a contract to cover extra shifts for 3 weeks. I was promised to get pay on my next pay checks and the manager decided to divide my bonus with my extra shift in 3 payments without notifications when I needed the money to pay my bills and support my kids. After that insult, I found no reason to stay. Same happened to several nurses that worked extra for MountainView. Not worth the stress, besides they triple ICU nurses everyday, and never bother to fix the problem. They pay good money but not worth loose your license over it because management is all about them, they will trow nurses under bus at anytime, even when is not the nurses fault but their poor management and administration.

review_title: Great pay great culture on the unit but not so great staffing
job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Las Vegas, NV
pros: workplace culture, pay, overtime opportunities.
cons: understaffed, holding high acuity patients, unsafe work environment at times. For example, not having enough rooms and having ICU level patients in the hallway.

review_title: Good hospital to start as a new nurse
job_title: Registered Nurse/NICU in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Decent pay and don’t have to pay for health insurance.
cons: They can care less about your well-being and egotistic environment

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: love my coworkers, we get the job done together.
cons: Lack of staffing resources really forces you to adapt, think ahead, etc. Can be overhwhelming.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Las Vegas, NV

job_title: APRN, FNP-C in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great atmosphere, teamwork, and has an excellent management team.
cons: not applicable in this area.

job_title: Rapid Response Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great benefits. HCA is uncomparable to other places with regard to benefits
cons: triple assignments are common in the icu. unsafe staffing ratios

review_title: Work with great people.. for now at least.
job_title: in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The staff is awesome. I've met some of the most skilled doctors and nurses while working here. Everyone is family. We have some of the best equipment (compared to other hospitals in the area) for helping patients.
cons: The hospital has gone down hill in the last few years. It used to be a great place with awesome people to work with and an administration that listened to the concerns of the employees. Now, our current CEO seems to be more concerned with numbers rather than employee satisfaction. The administration stresses the family atmosphere MountainView has with its employees yet laid off the entire PBX and Security departments to downside/consolidate and save money. You can guess how the staff feels about that move.

job_title: Staff RN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Las Vegas can be a fun city to live in being able to retreat to mountains, the desert, and the beach all within ~3hr drives. My coworkers were relatively friendly. Lots of opportunity for overtime (since they're so short staffed) which is great if you're strapped for cash. Compensations to cost-of-living is more than adequate.
cons: Consistently short staffed, CNO is completely out of touch with your typical staff nurse and the overall low morale of the hospital, very poor support for the nurses at night often left me anxious for both my patient and the safety of my nursing license. The union is worthless in my opinion, they seemed to have VERY little bargaining power with the hospital. Many clinical practices are outdated and/or contraindicated in light of current research, evidence-based practice is NOT practiced here.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Health benefit s are good for anyone with a family
cons: HCA only cares about their white hats making money than the well being of their staff

review_title: Team is great, but administration and corporate not supportive of nursing staff.
job_title: Registered Nurse, MSN in Emeryville, CA
pros: Staff members love what they do for the most part. The team really comes together in emergency situations staff support the community.
cons:
Mission, vision, and values is for looks. The company’s actual functioning does not coincide with what is stated. 

Never enough staff. Too much focus on nonsense things that do not help the patients. Too many chiefs and too few Indians. 

Abuse both verbal and physical toward staff from patrons or families is not addressed by administration. They turn a blind eye and pretend it was addressed. Sad.

review_title: HR is the one thing I’d stay away from if you wanna feel a part of something. They are monsters.
job_title: Medical Technologist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: People (at first) . Benefits, pay, compensation, some management. Overall a great job and experience.
cons: Do not ever go on FMLA! You’ll lose your job, dignity, respect, and the meaning of gossip and backstabbing. Many great people and bosses drowned out by petty miscommunication victims. HR is the most unprofessional group of people I’ve ever encountered, they don’t know labor laws, your rights, and when they learn they don’t care until the government comes knocking. Gossip and harassment go uninterrupted because management doesn’t want the work to stop because upper management is so disconnected from the bottom line.

job_title: Lab Assistant in Las Vegas, NV
pros: They are always busy....job security....
cons: They are for profit, in turn you work with skeleton crews. It seems the ER stays packed and the halls stay lined with hall bed patients and a lobby full of people, pretty much year round. Not to mention every time union contract negotiations come around we lose more benefits.....

review_title: For-Profit, not for patient or employee
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The pay is good, but due to the union influence. Mostly private rooms. Free health insurance.
cons: The workload and staffing is terrible. Been there 5 years and never had a staff meeting. Education is not paid for, only for RNs. Management is uncaring.

review_title: Honest ratings from someone who worked at MVH for more than 10 years
job_title: Staff RN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Easy access to freeway. Nurses union direct salary
cons: Too much politics. Not enough help. 99% of agency and travelers nurses do not come back

job_title: Ekg Technician in Las Vegas, NV

cons: short staff on grave yard shift most of the times during a 12 hour work schedule in which was a bit tough covering the whole hospital

job_title: Medical Staff Coordinator in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Cohesive team. We worked well together and functioned as a well oiled machine.  We were crossed trained and could handle the work load even when we were down a person.
cons: We were actually 3 people doing the work of 5. We needed 2 other FTEs.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: friendly nursing educators, Good pay and benefits
cons: For RN tele floor patient ratio 1:6-7 and for CNA 1:12-16. Always short staffed. They use meditech charting system. Goodluck finding your CNA. Charge nurses think they are the boss

review_title: Excellent experience.  Great community.  Great hospital.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
